pr_title: PrivGetLogs needs to check privacy group membership at given block

timeline.message:
PrivGetLogs needs to check privacy group membership at given block

Signed-off-by: Sally MacFarlane <sally.macfarlane@consensys.net>

timeline.bodyText:
We could name this method something like checkIfAuthenticatedUserWasMemberAtBlock. This way we reduce the cognitive gap. Not a big deal though.
Or if you like checkIfPrivacyGroupMatchesAuthenticatedEnclaveKey  keep it!
timeline.author: lucassaldanha

timeline.bodyText: We could encapsulate the map and orElseGet blocks into their own functions to make this main function a bit cleaner. Something like findLogsForBlockHash and findLogsForBlockRange
timeline.author: lucassaldanha
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,13 +71,27 @@ public JsonRpcResponse response(final JsonRpcRequestContext requestContext) {
         filter
             .getBlockHash()
             .map(
-                blockHash ->
-                    privacyQueries.matchingLogs(privacyGroupId, blockHash, filter.getLogsQuery()))
+                blockHash -> {

timeline.bodyText: Do we need this extra method? Why not return Collections.emptyList() straight away on line 78?
timeline.author: lucassaldanha

replies.bodyText: I had it that way but got a nasty unintuitive compile error!
replies.author: macfarla

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/hyperledger/besu into multi-tenancy-onchain-groups-logs

simplified getting the empty list
